title: WCAS INTL_ST 390-0-26 Special Topics in International Studies

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Community-based research partnerships can produce innovative solutions to community challenges and create a dynamic learning experience for students. This course will introduce students to approaches, methods, and ethical concerns related to conducting community-based research. It will highlight an asset-based approach to identifying community projects and producing actionable, accessible research findings. Students will explore the role of community-based researchers in both the field and academia and reflect on their personal interests and goals for participating in international development work. Practical applications of community-based research methods will prepare students to partner with local organizations and respond quickly to needs that arise during fieldwork. Additional topics to be covered include: access and relationship-building, power structures of research, and production and ownership of knowledge.
